A good name<S>8034</S> is rather to be chosen<S>977</S> than great<S>7227</S> riches<S>6239</S>, and loving<S>2896</S> favour<S>2580</S> rather than silver<S>3701</S> and gold<S>2091</S>. <sup>loving: or, favour is better than, etc</sup>
The rich<S>6223</S> and poor<S>7326</S> meet together<S>6298</S>: the LORD<S>3068</S> is the maker<S>6213</S> of them all.
A prudent<S>6175</S> man foreseeth<S>7200</S> the evil<S>7451</S>, and hideth<S>5641</S> <S>5641</S> himself: but the simple<S>6612</S> pass on<S>5674</S>, and are punished<S>6064</S>.
By<S>6118</S> humility<S>6038</S> and the fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> are riches<S>6239</S>, and honour<S>3519</S>, and life<S>2416</S>. <sup>By: or, The reward of humility, etc</sup>
Thorns<S>6791</S> and snares<S>6341</S> are in the way<S>1870</S> of the froward<S>6141</S>: he that doth keep<S>8104</S> his soul<S>5315</S> shall be far<S>7368</S> from them.
Train up<S>2596</S> a child<S>5288</S> in the way<S>1870</S> he should go<S>6310</S>: and when he is old<S>2204</S>, he will not depart<S>5493</S> from it. <sup>Train: or, Catechise</sup> <sup>in: Heb. in his way</sup>
The rich<S>6223</S> ruleth<S>4910</S> over the poor<S>7326</S>, and the borrower<S>3867</S> is servant<S>5650</S> to the lender<S>376</S> <S>3867</S>. <sup>the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth</sup>
He that soweth<S>2232</S> iniquity<S>5766</S> shall reap<S>7114</S> vanity<S>205</S>: and the rod<S>7626</S> of his anger<S>5678</S> shall fail<S>3615</S>. <sup>the rod: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed</sup>
He that hath a bountiful<S>2896</S> eye<S>5869</S> shall be blessed<S>1288</S>; for he giveth<S>5414</S> of his bread<S>3899</S> to the poor<S>1800</S>. <sup>He that: Heb. Good of eye</sup>
Cast out<S>1644</S> the scorner<S>3887</S>, and contention<S>4066</S> shall go out<S>3318</S>; yea, strife<S>1779</S> and reproach<S>7036</S> shall cease<S>7673</S>.
He that loveth<S>157</S> pureness<S>2890</S> <S>2889</S> of heart<S>3820</S>, for the grace<S>2580</S> of his lips<S>8193</S> the king<S>4428</S> shall be his friend<S>7453</S>. <sup>for: or, and hath grace in his lips</sup>
The eyes<S>5869</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> preserve<S>5341</S> knowledge<S>1847</S>, and he overthroweth<S>5557</S> the words<S>1697</S> of the transgressor<S>898</S>. <sup>the words: or, the matters</sup>
The slothful<S>6102</S> man saith<S>559</S>, There is a lion<S>738</S> without<S>2351</S>, I shall be slain<S>7523</S> in<S>8432</S> the streets<S>7339</S>.
The mouth<S>6310</S> of strange women<S>2114</S> is a deep<S>6013</S> pit<S>7745</S>: he that is abhorred<S>2194</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> shall fall<S>5307</S> therein.
Foolishness<S>200</S> is bound<S>7194</S> in the heart<S>3820</S> of a child<S>5288</S>; but the rod<S>7626</S> of correction<S>4148</S> shall drive it far<S>7368</S> from him.
He that oppresseth<S>6231</S> the poor<S>1800</S> to increase<S>7235</S> his riches, and he that giveth<S>5414</S> to the rich<S>6223</S>, shall surely come to want<S>4270</S>.
Bow down<S>5186</S> thine ear<S>241</S>, and hear<S>8085</S> the words<S>1697</S> of the wise<S>2450</S>, and apply<S>7896</S> thine heart<S>3820</S> unto my knowledge<S>1847</S>.
For it is a pleasant thing<S>5273</S> if thou keep<S>8104</S> them within<S>990</S> thee; they shall withal<S>3162</S> be fitted<S>3559</S> in thy lips<S>8193</S>. <sup>within: Heb. in thy belly</sup>
That thy trust<S>4009</S> may be in the LORD<S>3068</S>, I have made known<S>3045</S> to thee this day<S>3117</S>, even to thee. <sup>even: or, trust thou also</sup>
Have not I written<S>3789</S> to thee<S>8032</S> excellent things<S>7991</S> in counsels<S>4156</S> and knowledge<S>1847</S>,
That I might make thee know<S>3045</S> the certainty<S>7189</S> of the words<S>561</S> of truth<S>571</S>; that thou mightest answer<S>7725</S> the words<S>561</S> of truth<S>571</S> to them that send<S>7971</S> unto thee? <sup>to them: or, to those that send thee?</sup>
Rob<S>1497</S> not the poor<S>1800</S>, because he is poor<S>1800</S>: neither oppress<S>1792</S> the afflicted<S>6041</S> in the gate<S>8179</S>:
For the LORD<S>3068</S> will plead<S>7378</S> their cause<S>7379</S>, and spoil<S>6906</S> the soul<S>5315</S> of those that spoiled<S>6906</S> them.
Make no friendship<S>7462</S> with an angry<S>639</S> man<S>1167</S>; and with a furious<S>2534</S> man<S>376</S> thou shalt not go<S>935</S>:
Lest thou learn<S>502</S> his ways<S>734</S>, and get<S>3947</S> a snare<S>4170</S> to thy soul<S>5315</S>.
Be not thou one of them that strike<S>8628</S> hands<S>3709</S>, or of them that are sureties<S>6148</S> for debts<S>4859</S>.
If thou hast nothing to pay<S>7999</S>, why should he take away<S>3947</S> thy bed<S>4904</S> from under thee?
Remove<S>5253</S> not the ancient<S>5769</S> landmark<S>1366</S>, which thy fathers<S>1</S> have set<S>6213</S>. <sup>landmark: or, bound</sup>
Seest<S>2372</S> thou a man<S>376</S> diligent<S>4106</S> in his business<S>4399</S>? he shall stand<S>3320</S> before<S>6440</S> kings<S>4428</S>; he shall not stand<S>3320</S> before<S>6440</S> mean<S>2823</S> men. <sup>mean: Heb. obscure men</sup>
